intro: Lamyropsis, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. These plants are characterized by their compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. Lamyropsis species typically thrive in rocky or sandy soils and are often found in coastal or mountainous regions. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
